summary:
Why would you, as an academic, need a copyeditor at all?

You want your research to communicate, to make impact 
You want to link your purpose to your audience, to find your voice
You want an expert to simplify language without dumbing it down
You want variation in how you express yourself
You want imaginative language to keep your reader 'turning the pages' 
You want your English to be correct

I work as a copyeditor with the academic community and also freelance as an English language trainer for academic writing at the Technical University of Eindhoven. In addition, I mark International Baccalaureate examinations for English Language and Literature. For all of these, my role includes strengthening storytelling as well as argumentation and the correct use of language, all of which are crucial to academia. 

My interests include Humanities and the Social Science research on (de)colonization, cross-cultural and regional studies, migration, inclusion, and Asian Studies.

Do you write academic texts on these aspects of culture? Do you want to ensure that your text communicates exactly what you want it to? Are you looking for an editor to fine-tune your text? 
I will support you in editing your content to be clear and communicative and engage your reader.
You can rely on my skills as 

•	a native speaker of English 
•	editor/ language skills trainer in the field of academics
•	avid reader of fiction and non-fiction
•	storyteller 
•	published writer 
•	blogger on unwrapping culture 

More about me is on nandinibedi.com and taal-tale.com

My goal is to empower you with your English, and in doing so, feel pleasure at the connection you make with your reader.  If you are on the lookout for a valuable team member to copyedit your texts, get in touch. 
Together we can transform your research into a page-turner!
